intro: Lasianthus cyanocarpus var. subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved blue-fruited hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, blue-violet flowers. The fruit is a capsule that turns blue when mature, containing several seeds. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
